WOODSRR-d-10-02-03-WCTX.Contributing Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
WOODSRR-d-10-02-03-WCTX.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW RETURNED TO THE LONGVIEW PLANT SITE AT APPROXIMATELY 1:45PM.  THE BRAKEE GOT OFF THETRAIN AT THE AIR HOUSE TO LINE THE SWITCH FROM THE MAIN TO THE HOSTLING TRACK.  THE BRAKEE INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO COME AHEAD AND TIE UP.  THE CONDUCTOR PICKED UP THE BRAKEE AT THE AIR HOUSE, AND CHECKED THE SWITCH TOWARD THE NORPAC/ONP TRACK.  THEY PROTECTED THE ROAD CROSSING FOR THE TRAIN.  THEBRAKEE AND CONDUCTOR FAILED TO CHECK THE SWITCH BETWEEN THE HOSTLING TRACK AND THE STORAGE TRACK.IN RETROSPECT, IT WASN'T CHECKED BECAUSE "IT IS ALWAYS LINED TO THE HOSTLING TRACK".  THE BRAKEE ANDCONDUCTOR MOVED TO THE HOSTLING AREA TO ANOTHER SWITCH, WHICH WAS TO BE LINED TO THE FUELING TRACKVS. THE STANDING TRACK.  AFTER THE SWITCH AT FUEL TRACK HAD BEEN CHECKED, THE CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEE (IN THE TRUCK) WERE HEADING BEHIND THE FUELING TANK WHEN THEY HEARD A LOUD NOISE.  THEY TURNED AND SAW THE LOCOMOTIVE 305 HITTING FIRST A LARGE RAIL SERVICE CART AND THEN THE SPEEDER 710 FOLLOWED BY ASMALLER RAIL SERVICE CART, ALL BEING SHOVED INTO THE 300 & 309 LOCOMOTIVES PARKED ON THE STORAGE TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR RADIOED THE ENGINEER TO STOP THE TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER STOPPED THE TRAIN AS SOON AS HE COULD.  AFTER STOPPING, HE BACKED THE TRAIN UP 1/2 CAR LENGTH AND SET THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE.  HE LEFT THE ENGINE AND WALKED UP TO THE 305.  HE WAS LOCATED IN THE 307 LOCOMOTIVE, FURTHEST FROM THEINCIDENT AND ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE LOCOMOTIVE.  HE WAS BLIND TO THE SWITCH AND BLIND TO THE STOR

01-d-10-25-03-SNCX.Narrative: TRACK AND EQUIPMENT INSPECTORS FROM BOTH RAILROADS AND THE FRA ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT GAUGE FACTORS IN BOTH TRACK AND LOCOMOTIVE TENDER WHEEL SET MAY HAVE PLAYED A ROLE IN THIS DERAILMENT.  THOUGH FRATRACK AND EQUIPMENT INSPECTORS HAVE FOUND THAT TRACK GAUGE, GENERAL RAIL ANCHORING AND TIE AND SURFACE CONDITIONS WERE WITHIN LEGAL SPECIFICATIONS FOR THE CLASS OF TRACK AT THE INCIDENT SCENE, AND THAT BACK-TO-BACK MEASUREMENT OF THE LOCOMOTIVE TENDER WHEEL SET WERE WITH LEGAL LIMITS, THE COMBINATION OF POSSIBLE HIGH LIMIT TO TRACK GAUGE AND LOW LIMIT TO TENDER WHEEL SET GAUGE WERE POTENTIAL FACTORS IN THE CAUSE.

181688-d-10-06-03-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
181688-d-10-06-03-SOO.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
181688-d-10-06-03-SOO.Narrative: 1130 TOP END, ASSIGNMENT 4712 WAS MAKING UP THE SCRAP JOB AND HAD PICKED UP 37 TRACK TO SET WEST TWOCARS TO 32 TRACK BEYOND THE FIRST GROUP OF ARRESTERS.  ASSIGNMENT THEN SWITCHED 37 TRACK AND LEFT IT ON THE 32 CROSSOVER.  THE EAST CAR WAS ON THE SOUTH LEAD NEAR THE 34 TRACK SWITCH, WHICH IS EAST OF 32 TRACK SWITCH.   ASSIGNMENT THEN GAVE 32 TRACK AND 37 TRACK BACK TO THE HUMP, HAD BLOCK ON BOTH,AND PUT 41 TRACK TOGETHER AND SWITCHED CARS TO 42 AND 43.  APPROXIMATELY ONE-HOUR LATER, ASSIGNMENT4712 PULLED 32 CROSSOVER TO SWITCH THE CARS AND NOTICED DAMAGE TO THE EAST THREE CARS.  THE CREW STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND INSPECTED THE DRAG OF 17 CARS THEY HAD HOLD OF AND FOUND THE WEST CAR ON 32 TRACK HAD HIT THE DRAG OF CARS THEY HAD PULLED FROM 37 TRACK AND OUT ON THE LEAD.  THE CREW HAD MADETHE JOINT TO THE CARS ON THE 32 CROSSOVER WHICH IS ABOUT FIVE CARS WEST OF 32 SWITCH TO THE SOUTH LEAD.  A TOTAL OF NINE CARS HAD BEEN PULLED BY THE 32 SWITCH WITHOUT INCIDENT AND ALSO DURING THIS HOUR THE ENGINE HAD BEEN BY THE 32 SWITCH SEVERAL TIMES WITH 32 TRACK IN THE CLEAR.  THERE WERE 34 CARSON 32 TRACK AT THE TIME OF IMPACT.  THE WEST CAR THAT MADE CONTACT WITH THE DRAG BEING PULLED IS HS11110 A EMPTY BOXCAR AND DERAILED ONTO ITS SIDE.  SINCE 32 TRACK WAS SHOVED TO CLEAR THE ARRESTERSAT 0030, THE HUMP HAD HUMPED 14 LOADS OF GRAIN ON TOP OF 32 TRACK.  THESE LOADS, 8 OF WHICH WERE WITHIN SECONDS OR MINUTES OF EACH OTHER, CAME OUT OF THE GROUP AT 6.00 MPH.  THERE WERE NO OVERSPEEDS.

20031002-d-10-02-03-CLC.Contributing Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
20031002-d-10-02-03-CLC.Narrative: THE WOODS RR TRAIN CREW RETURNED TO THE LONGVIEW PLANT SITE AT APPROXIMATELY 1:45 PM.  THE BRAKEE GOT OFF THE TRAIN AT THE AIR HOUSE, TO LINE THE SWITCH FROM MAIN TO THE HOSTLING TRACK.  THE BRAKEE INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO COME AHEAD AND TIE UP .  THE CONDUCTOR PICKED UP THE BRAKEE AT THE AIR HOUSE AND CHECKED THE SWITCH TOWARD THE NORPAC/ONP TRACK. THE BRAKEE AND CONDUCTOR FAILED TO CHECK THE SWITCH BETWEEN THE HOSTLING TRACK AND THE STORAGE TRACK.  THIS WASN'T CHECKED BECAUSE "IT IS ALWAYS LINED TO THE HOSTLING TRACK."  AFTER THE SWITCH AT FUEL TRACK HAD BEEN CHECKED, THE CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEE (IN THE TRUCK) WERE HEADING BEHIND THE FUELING TANK WHEN THEY HEARD A LOUD NOISE.  THEY TURNED AND SAW THE LOCOMOTIVE 305 HITTING FIRST A LARGE RAIL SERVICE CART AND THEN THE SPEEDER #710 FOLLOWEDBY A SMALL CART.  THE IMPACT SHOVED THE CARTS AND SPEEDER INTO TWO LOCOMOTIVES THAT WERE ALSO PARKED  ON THIS STORAGE TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR RADIOED THE ENGINEER TO STOP THE TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER STOPPED THE TRAIN AS SOON HE COULD.  AFTER STOPPING THE TRAIN HE BACKED IT UP 1/2 CAR LENGTH AND SET THEINDEPENDENT BRAKE.  HE LEFT THE ENGINE AND WALKED UP TO THE 305.  HE WAS LOCATED IN THE 307 LOCOMOTIVE WHICH WAS FARTHEST FROM THE INCIDENT AND ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE LOCOMOTIVE.  HE WAS BLIND TO THE SWITCH AND BLIND TO THE STORAGE TRACK.  THE LOCOMOTIVE'S LOCATION ON THE TRACK AT THE TIME OF THEINCIDENT OBSCURED THE ENGINEER'S VIEW.  THE LARGE RAIL CART WAS KNOCKED OFF THE TRACK BY THE IMPACT
